text: [Music]
hello I'm Ashley a technical customer
service associate here at the AWS office
in Cape Town today I'm going to tell you
why you might receive a ball even after
you've closed your AWS account let's get
started there are a few reasons why you
might receive a ball after you closed
your
account you incur charges before you
close your account you receive a final
bill for any usage between the start of
the month and the date you closed your
account for example if you close your
account on January 15th you'll get a bll
in February for the usage from January
1st through January
15th active reserved instances if you
had reserved instances such as Amazon
elastic compute Cloud reserved instances
Amazon relational database service
reserved instances Amazon red shift
reserved instances or elastic cache
reserved nodes you'll continue to
receive blls until the reservation
period
expires savings plans any compute usage
covered by savings plans will still be
bold until the plan term is
complete AWS Marketplace subscriptions
these subscriptions don't automatically
cancel when you close your account you
must first terminate any software
instances under these subscriptions then
cancel the subscriptions from the AWS
Marketplace
console activate AWS support plan
support plans such as the developer
support plan or the bus business support
plan don't autocancel you must first
downgrade the support plan to basic
support before you close your AWS
account to view which AWS services that
you are using and that you are still
build
for choose builds from the left
navigation
pane expand the region under charges by
service you have 90 days after closing
to view past billing and to pay any
bills that are not yet
paid to view overdue blls choose
payments from the left navigation
pane find overdue blls in the payments
Due
tab next to each overdue bll choose
verify and pay if you don't see that
option then open a support case with AWS
support so that we can help you with a
payment and now you know why you might
receive a ball even after you've closed
your AWS
account thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Music]
